original: Anderzon, Bror Olof Zachæus, rektor, Lidköping, f. 15/12/84 i Ununge, Sthlms 1., av Alfred A. o. Selma Jans-dotter. G. 15 m. Margareta Jepsson. Barn: Bengt-Olof Unenge f. 16, ing., Äke Unenge 19, reklamkonstn., Bo Unenge 21, civiling., Börje Unenge 22, civilekon., rev., Jan-Olof Unenge 29, gymn. — Mog:ex. i Upps. 07, fil. mag. där 13, provår v. Gbgs h. latinlärov. 14. Vik. adj.^ i Umeå 09-10, extralär. där 15-22, adj. i tyska o. eng. där 22, rektors skrivbitr. där 16-27, vik. rektor där c:a nio mån., dito v. Umeå folksk :semin. 22 o. 23, rektor f. Lidköp. samrealsk. sed. 27. Var i Umeå bl. a. stadsfullm., ordf. i lönendn, led. av vatten- o. belysn :styr., styr. f. elem:rlärov. f. fl., sekr. i lärov :byggn :-komm., Västerb. läns tj :mannafören„ RK-distr., landstingets undervisn :ut-sk., andre dirig. i Umeå sångarförb. Led. av Lidköp. stadsfullm. (h.) sed. 31, ordf. i Lidköp. kyrkofullm. o. dis-pensärnd sed. 31, led. av kyrkoråd sed. 34, tax:nd sed. 35, folksk :styr. sed. 36, v. ordf. i styr. f. stadens verk, led. av drätselkamm., ordf. i Lungsjukas vård o. Majblommekomm., v. ordf. i Västergötl. isångarförb., ordf. i Lidköp. mod. valmansfören. m. m. Resor t. Finl., Norge, Danm., Engl. o. Tyskl. Skr.: Västerb. läns sångarförb. 1912- 22. RVO, Sv. Sångarförb. förtj:t., Västergötl. Sångarförb. förtj :t.
translated: Anderzon, Bror Olof Zachæus, principal, Lidköping, b. December 15th, 1884 in Ununge, Stockholm, son of Alfred A. and Selma Jans-dotter. Married to Margareta Jepsson for 15 years. Children: Bengt-Olof Unenge b. 1916, an engineer; Äke Unenge b. 1919, an advertising designer; Bo Unenge b. 1921, a civil engineer; Börje Unenge b. 1922, a civil economist, revenue; Jan-Olof Unenge b. 1929, a gymnasium student. Completed teacher training at Uppsala in 1907, received a Bachelor of Arts there in 1913, and was a teaching assistant in Umeå from 1909-1910, an extra teacher there from 1915-1922, and a teacher of German and English there from 1922. He was a writing assistant to the principal there from 1916-1927, a substitute principal for around nine months, a substitute principal at Umeå's primary school seminar in 1922 and 1923, and the principal of Lidköping's high school from 1927 onwards. Anderzon was a member of Umeå's city council, chairman of the salary committee, a member of the water and lighting committee, a governing board member of various elementary schools, treasurer of the school building committee, member of the Västerbotten's branch of the Teachers' Association, the Second District of the Örnsköldsvik's Hemslöjdsförening, and an official of the county council's education committee. He was a member of Lidköping's city council (h.) starting in 1931, chairman of the church council and the dispensary board since 1931, member of the church council since 1934, a tax commissioner since 1935, member of the elementary school committee since 1936, deputy chairman of the board for the city's utilities, a member of the finance committee, chairman of the Lungsjukan's care and Majblommekomm committees, deputy chairman of the Västergötl. singing association, chairman of Lidköping's modern voter association, and more. He traveled to Finland, Norway, Denmark, England, and Germany. Anderzon wrote for the Västerbotten's Singing Association from 1912-1922 and received the Royal Order of Vasa, the Swedish Singing Association's medal of merit, and the Västergötl. Singing Association's medal of merit.

award.name: Swedish Singing Association's medal of merit
Västergötl. Singing Association's medal of merit
